1 import time
2 from dataclasses import dataclass
3 from threading import Thread, Event
4 from typing import Callable
5 
6 import cv2
7 import numpy as np
8 
9 import rospy
10 from .abstract_stream import AbstractStream
11 
12 
13 @dataclass
14 class CameraConfig:
15  acquisition_rate: int
16  mtx: np.ndarray
17  dist: np.ndarray
18  width_img: float
19  height_img: float
20  flip: bool = False
21 
22 
23 class Rate:
24 
25  def __init__(self, hz: int):
26  self.__interval = 1.0 / hz
27  self.__last_time = time.time()
28 
29  def sleep(self):
30  now = time.time()
31  elapsed = now - self.__last_time
32  if elapsed < self.__interval:
33  time.sleep(self.__interval - elapsed)
34  self.__last_time = now
35 
36 
37 class Stream(AbstractStream):
38 
39  def __init__(self, camera_index: int, config: CameraConfig, publish_frame_cb: Callable[[np.ndarray], None]):
40  """
41  Initializes the camera stream.
42  :param camera_index: Index of the camera to use (0 for the first camera, 1 for the second, etc.)
43  :param config: Camera configuration
44  :param publish_frame_cb: Callback function to publish the frame
45  """
46  super().__init__(publish_frame_cb)
47  self.__camera_index = camera_index
48  self.__config = config
49 
50  self._frame = np.zeros((int(config.height_img), int(config.width_img), 3), dtype=np.uint8)
51  self.__acquisition_thread = None
52  self.__stop_acquisition = Event()
53  self.__rate = Rate(config.acquisition_rate)
54 
55  def __del__(self):
56  self.stop()
57 
58  @property
59  def is_available(self) -> bool:
60  """Checks if the camera is available."""
61  if self.is_active:
62  return True
63 
64  tmp_video_stream = cv2.VideoCapture(self.__camera_index)
65  is_opened = tmp_video_stream.isOpened()
66  tmp_video_stream.release()
67  return is_opened
68 
69  def start(self):
70  """Starts the video stream."""
71 
72  if self.__acquisition_thread is not None:
73  raise RuntimeError("Video stream is already started")
74 
75  self.__stop_acquisition.clear()
76  self.__acquisition_thread = Thread(target=self.__loop, daemon=True)
77  self.__acquisition_thread.start()
78 
79  def stop(self):
80  if self.__acquisition_thread is None:
81  raise RuntimeError("Video stream is already stopped")
82 
83  self.__stop_acquisition.set()
84  self.__acquisition_thread.join()
85  self.__acquisition_thread = None
86  self.__stop_acquisition.clear()
87 
88  def __process_frame(self, frame: np.ndarray):
89  """Processes the frame (e.g., flips it)."""
90  if self.__config.flip:
91  cv2.flip(frame, -1, dst=frame)
92 
93  cv2.undistort(src=frame, cameraMatrix=self.__config.mtx, distCoeffs=self.__config.dist, dst=self._frame)
94  self._post_process()
95 
96  def __loop(self):
97  video_stream = cv2.VideoCapture(self.__camera_index)
98  if not video_stream.isOpened():
99  raise RuntimeError("Can't connect to the camera")
100 
101  # This loop ensure the stream always restart after an error
102  while not self.__stop_acquisition.is_set():
103 
104  # Main acquisition loop
105  while video_stream.isOpened():
106  if self.__stop_acquisition.is_set():
107  video_stream.release()
108  break
109 
110  ret, frame = video_stream.read()
111  if not ret:
112  rospy.logwarn('Failed to read frame from camera')
113  break
114 
115  self.__process_frame(frame)
116  try:
117  self._publish_frame(self._frame)
118  except Exception as e:
119  rospy.logerr(f'Failed to publish frame: {e}')
120  self.__rate.sleep()
121 
122  # If we end up here, it means either the camera is not available anymore or we failed to get a frame
123  while not video_stream.isOpened() or video_stream.grab() is False:
124  if self.__stop_acquisition.is_set():
125  video_stream.release()
126  break
127 
128  time.sleep(1)
129  video_stream.open(self.__camera_index)
130 
131  @property
132  def image(self) -> np.ndarray:
133  return self._frame
134 
135  @property
136  def is_active(self) -> bool:
137  return self.__acquisition_thread is not None and not self.__stop_acquisition.is_set()
